page.title: 02PAGHAM PARISH CHURCH
page.content: The Reverend Maynard showed us around the church. There has been a church on the site for over 1000 years, going back to Saxon times. In 1929 {Queen {Mary}went to the church when{King {George V}was recovering at Craigwell House from an illness. It was after his stay that the king agreed to adding Regis to the town's name. Some of the services held at Pagham are very different to those in 1929, but Matins is almost the same. The{inside of the church}has changed quite a lot in the 15 years since Mr.Maynard came. There is some new flooring and new carpeting in the sanctuary. The box pews that the Queen used have been moved to the back of the church. The pipe organ has been replaced by an electronic one, the altar moved forward and the font moved to the north transept.
